intro: Praravinia suberosa, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wetlands and streambanks. Its leaves are rough to the touch and have a distinctive lobed shape. Praravinia suberosa produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences.
